top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina's technical rooty trails and rocky gravel — forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 131 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
99ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
13,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At mile 60 of 131, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina. Train it until it feels boring.
13,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on technical rooty trails and rocky gravel —. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Smooth pedaling at 131 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 13,000ft of climbing on technical rooty trails and rocky gravel — does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride technical rooty trails and rocky gravel — considerably more challenging than typical hard-pack at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 131 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 131 miles of technical rooty trails and rocky gravel — considerably more challenging than typical hard-pack in Hendersonville, North Carolina.
